Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red0\green128\blue255;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\cf1\b\f0\fs20 You can set the Splitter Window size dynamically by using an Expression for \cf2 Form Properties->Split->Splitter Offset%\cf1 .\par \par In this example, you can slide the "Set Splitter" slider and the splitter will resize. \par \par \par \par \par \par }

ExpSyntax.val: 'SP04: How Do I Dynamically Set the Offset of the Splitter?'

Text.val: After leaving Field 7, a Close event is raised.
The Cnd is used to make this task dual-purpose: that is, it can be used without
being in a Subform, and in that case the task won't close after leaving Field 7.
This is logic that will only be executed the first time the Subform is executed.

STP.TXT: This logic only happens when the user tabs into the Subform.
